page.title: 07BRIDGE OF WEIR - LEISURE 2
page.content: My name is Douglas. Like millions of others I take pastimes seriously.They take my mind off my worries.If more people took part the world might be a better place.Here is a tennis poem. {Bong! The vital game has started, {Sprinting to reach the racing ball, {I drive it back at him, {Attacking and defending, {Every point is crucial, {Point after point our scores build up, {Will this taxing game ever end ? {The ball spins and bends with speed, {Aching blisters spread rapidly, {Sweat pours down our faces, {At last - one point away from victory, {What a time to serve a double fault, {Back to square one again, {Later I limp off aching all over, {I have suffered, {Pain, agony and torture, } {Just to lose a club game of tennis! }
